title: Movie Producer Will List Pacific Palisades Home for $16.9 Million
text:
A Mediterranean-style mansion in the Pacific Palisades neighborhood of Los Angeles, is set to list on Friday for $16.9 million, Mansion Global has learned.



The seller is producer Steven Chasman and his wife, the actress Nadia Farès Chasman, professionally known as Nadia Farès, property records show. Lisa Optican of Compass has the listing.



Ms. Optican was not immediately available for comment.



More: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey Finds Buyer for Los Angeles House in Less Than Three Weeks

Listing photos show a sun-soaked living room with cathedral ceilings, bay windows and French doors complete with lunettes. Photos also show massive French sliding doors leading out to a private terrace from one of the bedrooms, offering views of the surrounding hillside greenery.



Outside of the six-bedroom, six-bathroom house, photos show a pool and pergola-covered lounge area, and an outdoor living space with a fire pit overlooking the Pacific Ocean and nearby vineyards.



The house is located on a 1.2-acre lot in the gated community of Ridgeview Country Estates, known as an enclave for Los Angeles-based entertainment executives.



Other residents of the 46-lot community include Martin Campbell, who directed films including “Green Lantern” and “Casino Royale”; Tony Vinciquerra, CEO of Sony; Jason Heyman, an agent at United Talent Agency; and Michael Sitrick, founder and CEO of public relations firm Sitrick & Company Communications, according to Compass.

Completed in 1988, the 6,185-square-foot home was renovated in 1995, records show, when James Lansbury, who worked as an assistant director on television series “Seinfeld” and “Townies,” bought it. Mr. Lansbury sold the house to Mr. Chasman and Ms. Farès in 2006 for $6.875 million, records show.



Mr. Chasman is best known for his work on the “Fast and the Furious” film series, and “The Transporter” film series. Ms. Farès is a French actress best known for her role in the television series “Les Ombres Rouges.”



Mr. Chasman and Ms. Farès were not immediately available for a request to comment.
